definition[0]: the long thin part of a plant, from which leaves, flowers, or fruit grow
definition[1]: the long thin part of a wine glass, vase etc, between the base and the wide top
definition[2]: the narrow tube of a pipe used to smoke tobacco
definition[3]: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’
definition[4]: to stop something from happening, spreading, or developing
example[0]: The measures are meant to stem the tide of illegal immigration.
example[1]: an attempt to stem the decline in profits
definition[5]: to stop the flow of a liquid
example[2]: A tight bandage should stem the bleeding.
definition[6]: the abbreviation of  science, technology, engineering, and mathematics, used especially when talking about education
